toolSpecificData.result:
I now have a complete picture of the entire API project. Here is the comprehensive analysis:

---

# Relat√≥rio Completo da API ‚Äî STT (Speech-To-Text)

## 1. Solution Structure

**Solution file**: [Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.sln](Api/src/Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.sln)

### Projects (5 total, organized in solution folders)

| Solution Folder | Project | Type |
|---|---|---|
| **0 - Presentation** | `Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.Api` | ASP.NET Web API (.NET 8) |
| **1 - Domain** | `Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.Domain` | Class Library (.NET 8) |
| **2 - Infrastructure** | `Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.Infra.Data.Queries` | Class Library (.NET 8) |
| **2 - Infrastructure** | `Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.Infra.Cache` | Class Library (.NET 8) |
| **3 - Tests** | `Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.UnitTests` | xUnit Test Project (.NET 8) |

### Dependency Graph

```
Api ‚Üí Domain, Infra.Data.Queries, Infra.Cache
Infra.Data.Queries ‚Üí Domain
Infra.Cache ‚Üí Domain
UnitTests ‚Üí Domain, Infra.Data.Queries, Infra.Cache
```

---

## 2. API Endpoints

### `SpeechTextController` ‚Äî Route: `api/v1/speech-text`

| Method | Route | Parameters | Description |
|---|---|---|---|
| `GET` | `/transcription` | `workId` (query, **required**) | Retrieves transcription status by workId. Cache-first, falls back to BigQuery. Returns `GetTranscriptionQueryResponse`. |
| `GET` | `/latency` | `workId` (query, optional), `dataInicio` (query, optional), `dataFim` (query, optional) | Calculates processing latency. Supports lookup by single workId or by date range. Compares GCS file creation time vs BigQuery row creation time. |

### `UrlController` ‚Äî Route: `api/v1/url`

| Method | Route | Parameters | Description |
|---|---|---|---|
| `GET` | `/signed/upload` | _(none)_ | Generates a signed GCS upload URL. Returns `{ SignedUrl, WorkId }`. |
| `POST` | `/signed/upload` | `CreateSignedUrlUploadRequest` (body: `PromptId`, `Platform`) | Generates a signed URL with prompt/platform path structure AND inserts a record into BigQuery. Returns `{ SignedUrl, WorkId, PromptId, Platform }`. |

Both controllers extend `BaseController` (from `Hapvida.Core.Api.Http`) which uses **MediatR** to dispatch queries/commands via `ExecuteAsync()`.

---

## 3. Domain Layer

### 3.1 Models (in `Domain/Models/v1/`)

| Class | Description |
|---|---|
| `GoogleCloudStorageSettings` | Options class for `Core:GoogleCloudStorage` config section. Properties: `ProjectId`, `BucketName`, `CredentialsBase64`, `UrlExpirationMinutes` (default 15), `DefaultUploadContentType`, `DefaultExtension`, `GoogleBigQuery` (nested). |
| `GoogleBigQueryOptionsSettings` | Nested settings: `DataSet`, `Table`. |
| `GoogleCloudStorageFile` | Record: `Name`, `CreatedAt` (DateTimeOffset?), `Size` (ulong?). |
| `GetTranscriptionOnBigQueryResponse` | `FileName`, `EncounterId`, `Transcription`, `Symptoms`, `SuggestedCIDs`, `WorkStatus` (enum), `ReadyFields`, `CreatedAt`. |
| `GetTranscriptionQueryResponse` | `EncounterId`, `Transcription`, `Symptoms`, `SuggestedCIDs`, `WorkStatus`, `CreatedAt`. JSON property names annotated. |
| `GetSignedUrlUploadResponse` | `SignedUrl`, `WorkId`. (Note: in namespace `Hapvvida` ‚Äî typo.) |

### 3.2 DTOs (in `Domain/Dtos/`)

| Class | Properties |
|---|---|
| `ConsultaStatusDto` | `WorkId`, `EncounterId`, `Transcription`, `Symptoms` (List\<string\>), `SuggestedCIDs` (List\<SuggestedCid\>), `WorkStatus` (enum), `CreatedAt`. |
| `RowDto` | `WorkId`, `EncounterId`, `Symptoms`, `Transcription`, `SuggestedCIDs`, `WorkStatus`, `ReadyFields`, `CreatedAt`. Used internally by BigQuery wrapper. |
| `SuggestedCid` | `Code`, `Description`. JSON property names annotated. |
| `SignedUrlRecordDto` | `WorkId`, `PromptId`, `Platform`, `SignedUrl`, `CreatedAt`. Used for BigQuery inserts. |
| `TranscriptionSummaryDto` | `WorkId`, `CreatedAt`. Lightweight DTO for latency calculations. |
| `LatencyRowDto` | `WorkId`, `FileName`, `BigQueryCreatedAtUtc`. |
| `ProcessingLatencyItemDto` | `FileName`, `BucketCreatedAt`, `BigQueryCreatedAt`, `SizeInMb`, `LatencySeconds`. |

### 3.3 Enums

| Enum | Values |
|---|---|
| `WorkStatus` | `Processing = 0`, `Completed = 1`, `Pending = 2` |
| `TimeToExpireTokenType` | `DefaultTime = 1`, `SystemParameter = 2`, `SystemRegister = 3` |

### 3.4 Contracts/Interfaces

**Services** (`Domain/Contracts/v1/Services/`):

| Interface | Methods |
|---|---|
| `IBigQueryServiceReader` | `GetLatestByWorkIdAsync(string workId, CancellationToken)` ‚Üí `ConsultaStatusDto?`; `GetTranscriptionsByPeriodAsync(DateTimeOffset start, end, CancellationToken)` ‚Üí `IReadOnlyList<TranscriptionSummaryDto>`; `GetLatestTranscriptionByWorkIdAsync(string workId, CancellationToken)` ‚Üí `TranscriptionSummaryDto?` |
| `IBigQueryServiceWriter` | `InsertSignedUrlRecordAsync(SignedUrlRecordDto record, CancellationToken)` ‚Üí `bool` |
| `ICacheService` | `GetCacheAsync(string key, CancellationToken)` ‚Üí `string`; `SetCacheAsync(key, value, CancellationToken)`; `SetCacheAsync(key, value, TimeToExpireTokenType, CancellationToken)` |
| `IGenerateUrlSignedService` | `GenerateForUploadAsync()` ‚Üí `(string signedUrl, string workId)`; `GenerateForUploadAsync(string prompt, string platform)` ‚Üí `(string signedUrl, string workId)` |
| `IGoogleCloudStorageService` | `GetObjectAsync(string objectName, CancellationToken)` ‚Üí `GoogleCloudStorageFile?`; `ListByCreatedAtAsync(DateTimeOffset? from, to, CancellationToken)` ‚Üí `IReadOnlyList<GoogleCloudStorageFile>` |

**Wrappers** (`Domain/Contracts/v1/Wrappers/`):

| Interface | Methods |
|---|---|
| `IBigQueryClientWrapper` | `ExecuteQueryAsync(string sql, BigQueryParameter[], QueryOptions?, CancellationToken)` ‚Üí `IEnumerable<RowDto>` |

### 3.5 Services (implementations in `Domain/Services/v1/`)

| Class | Implements | Description |
|---|---|---|
| `BigQueryCheckStatusService` | `IBigQueryServiceReader` | Queries BigQuery for transcription status. **3 methods**: lookup by workId (full status), lookup by workId (summary only), and batch lookup by date period. Uses parameterized SQL with `@workId`, `@startDate`, `@endDate`. Delegates to `IBigQueryClientWrapper`. |
| `BigQueryWriterService` | `IBigQueryServiceWriter` | Inserts signed URL records into BigQuery via `INSERT INTO` SQL. Parameters: workId, promptId, platform, signedUrl, createdAt, workStatus="Processing". Returns `false` on error (does not throw). |
| `GenerateUrlSignedService` | `IGenerateUrlSignedService` | Creates Google Cloud Storage signed URLs for upload using `UrlSigner`. Decodes Base64 credentials at construction. Object naming: no-prompt ‚Üí `{workId}.webm`; with-prompt ‚Üí `{prompt}/{platform}/{workId}.webm`. Expiration: 30 minutes. |
| `GoogleCloudStorageService` | `IGoogleCloudStorageService` | Uses `StorageClient` with read-only scope. `GetObjectAsync` fetches a single GCS object by name (+.webm). `ListByCreatedAtAsync` lists ALL bucket objects and filters by date range client-side. |

### 3.6 Wrappers

| Class | Implements | Description |
|---|---|---|
| `BigQueryClientWrapper` | `IBigQueryClientWrapper` | Wraps `BigQueryClient.ExecuteQueryAsync()`. Maps row results to `RowDto` using `BigQueryRowExtensions` helper. Handles JSON-encoded `suggestedCIDs` field. Determines `WorkStatus` from string "completed". |

### 3.7 Helpers

| Class | Description |
|---|---|
| `BigQueryRowExtensions` | Static extension methods for `BigQueryRow`: `TryGetValue()`, `Get<T>()`, `GetArray<T>()`, `GetJsonArray<TOut>()` (handles JSON strings and repeated fields), `GetPropString()` for `JsonElement`. |

### 3.8 Resources

| Class | Description |
|---|---|
| `Constants` | `InfoAudioFile`, `InfoJsonDeserializedParent`, `InfoJsonDeserializedChild` |
| `LogsTemplate` | Structured log templates: `StartHandler`, `InfoHandler`, `EndHandler`, `TraceHandler`, `ErrorHandler`, `WarningHandler` |
| `Message` | User-facing messages (Portuguese): `WorkIdRequired`, `TranscriptionNotFound`, `Pending`, `GettingFromCache`, `AddingToCache`, `GettingFromBigQuery`, `DateByPeriodRequired`, `DataInicioGreaterThanDataFim` |

---

## 4. Infrastructure Layer (Infra.Data.Queries)

### 4.1 Queries (MediatR Query Handlers)

#### `GetTranscriptionQuery` / `GetTranscriptionHandler`
- **Input**: `GetTranscriptionQuery(string WorkId)` extends `Query`
- **Flow**: Validate workId ‚Üí Try cache ‚Üí If miss, query BigQuery via `IBigQueryServiceReader.GetLatestByWorkIdAsync` ‚Üí Map to `GetTranscriptionQueryResponse` via AutoMapper ‚Üí Cache result ‚Üí Return
- **Cache strategy**: Read-through with `JsonSerializer`

#### `GetSignedUrlUploadQuery` / `GetSignedUrlUploadHandler`  
- **Input**: `GetSignedUrlUploadQuery()` (no parameters)
- **Flow**: Call `IGenerateUrlSignedService.GenerateForUploadAsync()` ‚Üí Return `GetSignedUrlUploadResponse { SignedUrl, WorkId }`

#### `GetProcessingLatencyQuery` / `GetProcessingLatencyHandler`
- **Input**: `GetProcessingLatencyQuery(string? WorkId, DateTime? DataInicio, DateTime? DataFim)` with helpers `IsByWorkId`, `IsByPeriod`
- **Flow**: Validate parameters ‚Üí If by period: GCS `ListByCreatedAtAsync` + BigQuery `GetTranscriptionsByPeriodAsync` ‚Üí correlate by workId, calculate latency. If by workId: GCS `GetObjectAsync` + BigQuery `GetLatestTranscriptionByWorkIdAsync` ‚Üí calculate single item latency.
- **Output**: `GetProcessingLatencyResponse { DataInicio, DataFim, Itens: List<ProcessingLatencyItemDto> }`

### 4.2 Commands

#### `CreateSignedUrlUploadCommand` / `CreateSignedUrlUploadHandler`
- **Input**: `CreateSignedUrlUploadCommand(string Prompt, string Platform)` extends `Command`
- **Request DTO**: `CreateSignedUrlUploadRequest { PromptId [Required], Platform [Required] }`
- **Flow**: `IGenerateUrlSignedService.GenerateForUploadAsync(prompt, platform)` ‚Üí `IBigQueryServiceWriter.InsertSignedUrlRecordAsync(record)` ‚Üí Return `CreateSignedUrlUploadResponse { SignedUrl, WorkId, PromptId, Platform }`
- **Resilience**: If BigQuery insert fails, still returns the signed URL (logs warning)

### 4.3 AutoMappers

| Profile | Mappings |
|---|---|
| `MappingProfiles` | `ConsultaStatusDto` ‚Üí `GetTranscriptionOnBigQueryResponse`; `ConsultaStatusDto` ‚Üí `GetTranscriptionQueryResponse` |

---

## 5. Infra.Cache Layer

### Models
- **`CacheSettings`**: Options class for `Core:Cache`. Properties: `ConnectionString`, `InstanceName`, `MinutesToExpireToken` (Dictionary\<string, int\>). Method `GetOptions(TimeToExpireTokenType)` returns `DistributedCacheEntryOptions` with absolute expiration.

### Services
- **`CacheService`** (`ICacheService`): Wraps `IDistributedCache` (Redis via StackExchange). `GetCacheAsync` swallows exceptions ‚Üí returns empty string. `SetCacheAsync` swallows exceptions ‚Üí logs error. Default expiration uses `TimeToExpireTokenType.DefaultTime`.

---

## 6. Dependency Injection (Bootstrapper.cs)

[Bootstrapper.cs](Api/src/Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.Api/Bootstrapper.cs) registers:

| Service | Implementation | Lifetime |
|---|---|---|
| `IGenerateUrlSignedService` | `GenerateUrlSignedService` | Scoped |
| `IBigQueryServiceReader` | `BigQueryCheckStatusService` | Scoped |
| `IBigQueryServiceWriter` | `BigQueryWriterService` | Scoped |
| `IBigQueryClientWrapper` | `BigQueryClientWrapper` | Singleton |
| `IGoogleCloudStorageService` | `GoogleCloudStorageService` | Singleton |
| `ICacheService` | `CacheService` | Singleton |
| SwaggerGenOptions | `ServerUrlDocumentFilter` | ‚Äî |
| Redis `IDistributedCache` | `AddStackExchangeRedisCache` | ‚Äî |

**Validation at startup**: The Bootstrapper validates all required GCS and Cache settings with `ArgumentNullException.ThrowIfNull()`, failing fast if any config is missing.

**Program.cs additional registrations** (via `Hapvida.Core` packages):
- `AddAppContext<Program>` ‚Äî Core API setup (controllers, Swagger, health checks, etc.)
- `AddDomainContext` ‚Äî MediatR, AutoMapper scanning of assemblies listed in `Core:Domain:Assemblies`
- `AddOpenTelemetryContext` ‚Äî OpenTelemetry with OTLP exporter
- Kestrel configuration from `Core:Kestrel`

---

## 7. Configuration

### appsettings.json structure

```
Core:
  Application:
    Name: "Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.Api"
    Version: "1.0"
    SupportedCultures: ["pt-BR", "en-US"]
  Domain:
    Assemblies: ["...Domain", "...Infra.Data.Queries"]  ‚Üê for MediatR/AutoMapper scanning
  Telemetry:
    ConnectionString: "http://localhost:4317"  (OTLP)
    MinimumLevel: "Debug"
  Cache:
    ConnectionString: "localhost:6379"
    InstanceName: "Hapvida"
    MinutesToExpireToken:
      DefaultTime: 2
      SystemParameter: 60
      SystemRegister: 60
  GoogleCloudStorage:
    ProjectId, BucketName, CredentialsBase64 (Base64 JSON SA key)
    UrlExpirationMinutes: 15
    DefaultUploadContentType: "video/webm"
    DefaultExtension: ".webm"
    GoogleBigQuery:
      Dataset: "bigquery_dataset"
      Table: "File_Transcription"
  Kestrel:
    Limits:
      MaxRequestBodySize: 62914560 (60MB)
      KeepAliveTimeout: "00:05:00"
      RequestHeadersTimeout: "00:02:00"
```

---

## 8. NuGet Packages

### Internal (Hapvida.*) ‚Äî from private Azure Artifacts feed

| Package | Version | Project |
|---|---|---|
| `Hapvida.Core.Api.Http` | 2.1.2 | Api |
| `Hapvida.Core.Domain` | 2.1.1 | Domain |
| `Hapvida.Core.Infra.OpenTelemetry.Exporter.Collector` | 2.1.0 | Domain |
| `Hapvida.Core.Infra.Services.Http` | 2.1.0 | Infra.Data.Queries |

### External

| Package | Version | Project |
|---|---|---|
| `Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2` | 3.11.0 | Domain |
| `Google.Cloud.Storage.V1` | 4.13.0 | Domain, Infra.Data.Queries |
| `Google.Apis.Auth` | 1.71.0 | Infra.Data.Queries |
| `Microsoft.Extensions.Caching.StackExchangeRedis` | 8.0.7 | Domain |
| `Microsoft.Extensions.Caching.Abstractions` | 8.0.0 | Infra.Cache |
| `NAudio` | 2.2.1 | Domain |
| `System.Text.Json` | 10.0.0-rc.1 | Domain |
| `Newtonsoft.Json` | 13.0.4 | Infra.Data.Queries |
| `Refit` | 8.0.0 | Infra.Data.Queries |
| `System.Management` | 10.0.0-rc.1 | Infra.Data.Queries |
| `Xabe.FFmpeg` | 6.0.2 | Infra.Data.Queries |
| `Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting` | 8.0.1 | Infra.Data.Queries |
| **Test packages** | | |
| `xunit` | 2.9.0 | UnitTests |
| `xunit.runner.visualstudio` | 2.8.2 | UnitTests |
| `Moq` | 4.20.70 | UnitTests |
| `NSubstitute` | 5.3.0 | UnitTests |
| `Bogus` | 35.5.1 | UnitTests |
| `coverlet.collector` | 6.0.2 | UnitTests |
| `Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk` | 17.10.0 | UnitTests |

---

## 9. Unit Tests

### Test Classes (8 total)

| Test Class | Target | Pattern | Framework |
|---|---|---|---|
| `CreateSignedUrlUploadHandlerTests` | `CreateSignedUrlUploadHandler` | 5 tests: success, BigQuery failure resilience, exception propagation, parameterized inputs | NSubstitute + xUnit |
| `GetTranscriptionHandlerTests` | `GetTranscriptionHandler` | 5 tests: validation, cache hit, BigQuery hit + cache set, BigQuery miss, cancellation | NSubstitute + AutoMapper + xUnit |
| `GetProcessingLatencyHandlerTests` | `GetProcessingLatencyHandler` | 3 tests: validation error, period-based latency calc, workId-based latency calc | Moq + xUnit |
| `GetBigQueryCheckStatusServiceTests` | `BigQueryCheckStatusService` | 7 tests: ctor validation, empty workId, cancellation, no results, data mapping, date normalization, exception propagation | NSubstitute + xUnit |
| `BigQueryWriterServiceTests` | `BigQueryWriterService` | 6 tests: ctor validation, empty workId, cancellation, success, exception returns false, all parameters sent | NSubstitute + xUnit |
| `GenerateUrlSignedServiceTests` | `GenerateUrlSignedService` | 7 tests: null checks, missing config, invalid Base64, conditional tests gated by `GCS_TEST_SA_B64` env var | Moq + xUnit |
| `CacheServiceTests` | `CacheService` | 3 tests: get value, get exception ‚Üí empty, set exception ‚Üí suppressed + logged | NSubstitute + xUnit |
| `BigQueryRowExtensionsTests` | `BigQueryRowExtensions` | 7 tests: basic type, repeated type, JSON repeated type, `GetPropString` variations | xUnit |

**Notable patterns**:
- Mix of **Moq** and **NSubstitute** (inconsistent ‚Äî both are referenced)
- `[Fact]` and `[Theory]` with `[InlineData]`

## 14. Code Patterns & Observations

### Architecture
- **Layered architecture**: Presentation ‚Üí Domain ‚Üí Infrastructure, with proper dependency inversion (interfaces in Domain, implementations in Infra)
- **CQRS-lite** via MediatR (`Query`/`Command` base classes from `Hapvida.Core.Domain`)
- **Cache-aside pattern** in `GetTranscriptionHandler`

### Naming
- **Namespaces**: `Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.*` ‚Äî however there's a **persistent typo**: `Hapvvida` (double 'v') in `Infra.Data.Queries` namespace (`RootNamespace` in csproj is `Hapvvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.Infra.Data.Queries`)
- **Versioned folders**: `v1/` throughout all layers
- **Portuguese** in messages/logs, English in code

### Error Handling
- Constructor validation with `ArgumentNullException.ThrowIfNull()` and `throw new InvalidOperationException()`
- Domain notifications via `IDomainContextNotifications.Add()` with `NotificationType.ValidationError`
- `CancellationToken` checked explicitly at handler entry points
- Cache operations swallow exceptions (resilient)
- BigQueryWriter returns `false` on failure rather than throwing

### Logging
- Structured logging throughout with `ILogger<T>`
- Consistent template usage via `LogsTemplate` static class
- Levels: Information (start/end), Debug (trace), Warning (validation/cancel), Critical (unexpected errors), Error (cache/BigQuery failures)

### Potential Issues / Tech Debt
1. **Namespace typo**: `Hapvvida` vs `Hapvida` causes import inconsistency across the codebase
2. **Mixed mocking frameworks**: Both `Moq` and `NSubstitute` are used in tests
3. **`System.Text.Json` 10.0.0-rc.1** and `System.Management` 10.0.0-rc.1 are **pre-release** packages on a .NET 8 target
4. **`NAudio`**, **`Xabe.FFmpeg`**, **`Refit`**, **`System.Management`** are referenced but no usage visible in the scanned source files ‚Äî possibly unused or used in removed code
5. **`Commands\` folder is explicitly excluded** from Domain.csproj compilation (`<Compile Remove="Commands\**" />`)
6. **GCS `ListByCreatedAtAsync`** lists ALL objects in bucket then filters client-side ‚Äî potential performance issue at scale
7. **appsettings.json contains dev credentials** (Base64-encoded GCS service account private key)
8. **`GetSignedUrlUploadResponse`** lives under `Domain/Models/v1/` but its namespace is `Hapvvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.Infra.Data.Queries.v1.GetSignedUrlUpload` ‚Äî mismatched physical location vs namespace

Implementa `BackgroundService`. Simplesmente cria um `TranscriptionsCommand` e delega ao handler:

```csharp
public class TransactionConsumerHandler : BackgroundService
{
    private readonly TranscriptionsCommandHandler _transcriptionsCommandHandler;

    protected override async Task ExecuteAsync(CancellationToken stoppingToken)
    {
        var command = new TranscriptionsCommand();
        await _transcriptionsCommandHandler.Handle(command, stoppingToken);
    }
}
```

## 3. Domain Layer

### 3.1 Commands

**Depend√™ncias do construtor**:

- `IGoogleCredentialProvider`

- `ITranscriptionMessageProcessor`

**Construtor principal** (usado pelo DI) chama `BuildSubscriberTaskAsync()` que constr√≥i um `SubscriberClient` usando:
```csharp
subClientBuilder.GoogleCredential = credentialProvider.GetCredential();
subClientBuilder.SubscriptionName = new SubscriptionName(project, subscriber);
```

**`Handle()` flow**:
1. Awaits `SubscriberClient` task
2. Calls `subscriber.StartAsync()` ‚Äî long-running listener
3. For each message:
   - Validates `eventType == "OBJECT_FINALIZE"` via `PubSubMessageEventHelper`
   - Extracts UTF-8 body: `message.Data.ToStringUtf8()`
   - Delegates to `_messageProcessor.ProcessAsync(json, messageId, cancel)`
   - Returns `Ack` on success; `Nack` on exception
4. Wraps entire block in try/catch logging **"ERRO CR√çTICO"** if subscriber crashes

### 3.9 Services

#### [GoogleCredentialProvider.cs](Consumer/src/Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.Ai.Domain/Services/v1/GoogleCredentialProvider.cs)

- Recebe `Base64JsonFile` via `IOptions<GoogleCredentialSettings>`
- Decodifica Base64 ‚Üí stream ‚Üí `CredentialFactory.FromStream<ServiceAccountCredential>()` ‚Üí `CreateScoped("cloud-platform")`
- Singleton, credencial criada no construtor

#### [TranscriptionMessageProcessor.cs](Consumer/src/Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.Ai.Domain/Services/v1/TranscriptionMessageProcessor.cs)

N√∫cleo do processamento. `ProcessAsync()` flow:

1. **Desserializa** JSON ‚Üí `EventFile` via `EventFileHelper`
2. **Extrai workId** do nome do arquivo: `evtFile.Name?.Split('.').FirstOrDefault()`
3. **Monta URI**: `gs://{bucket}/{name}`
4. **Chama Vertex AI**: `_vertexAiService.SendForTranscriptionAsync(uri, credential, messageId, workId)`
5. **Retry logic**: Se `shouldRetry == true` (HTTP 429), retorna `Nack`
6. **Desserializa resposta** em `ClinicalResponse` via `FormatData()`
7. **Persiste em paralelo**: `Task.WhenAll(cacheTask, bigQueryTask)`
   - Cache: `_cacheService.SetCacheAsync(workId, contents)`
   - BigQuery: `_bigQueryService.InsertCompletedTranscriptionAsync(workId, clinicalResponse, messageId)`
8. **Error handling**: Se BigQuery falha ‚Üí `Nack`; Se Cache falha ‚Üí ignora

#### [VertexAiService.cs](Consumer/src/Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.Ai.Domain/Services/v1/VertexAiService.cs)

`SendForTranscriptionAsync()` flow:

1. **Valida** URI e Endpoint
2. **Busca prompt e platform** via `GetPromptAndPlatformAsync()`:
   - Consulta BigQuery ‚Üí `_bigQueryService.GetPromptByWorkIdAsync(workId)`
   - Se n√£o encontra ‚Üí usa `PromptDefault.Anamnesis` + `SourcePlatform.Telehealth`
3. **Monta request**:
   - `Content` com `Role = "user"`, 2 parts: `FileData(uri, "audio/mpeg")` + `Text(promptText)`
   - `GenerateContentConfig` com `Temperature = 0.0`, `TopP = 0.95`, `ResponseMimeType = "application/json"`
   - `ThinkingConfig.ThinkingBudget = 0` (desabilita thinking)
   - `ResponseSchema = TranscriptionSchemaResponse.Schema` (structured output)
   - `Labels = SourcePlatformHelper.ToLabels(platform)`
4. **Chama** `_vertexClientWrapper.GenerateAsync(model, contents, config, credential, options)`
5. **Error handling**:
   - `Google.GenAI.ClientError` com `StatusCode == 429` ‚Üí `shouldRetry = true`
   - Outras `ClientError` ‚Üí `shouldRetry = false`
   - Exception gen√©rica ‚Üí `shouldRetry = false`
6. **Persiste metadata** em BigQuery: `InsertUsageMetadataAsync(workId, messageId, tokenData)`
7. **Extrai texto** via `GenerateContentResponseHelper.ValidateAndExtract()`

#### [BigQueryService.cs](Consumer/src/Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.Ai.Domain/Services/v1/BigQueryService.cs)

3 m√©todos:

## 10. Code Patterns

### Naming
- **Namespaces**: `Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.Ai.{Layer}.{Folder}.v1`
- **Files**: PascalCase, matching class names
- **Versioning**: `v1` folders in every layer (Consumers, Commands, Contracts, Models, Services, Wrappers)
- **Settings classes**: `{Feature}Settings` (PubSubSettings, BigQuerySettings, VertexSettings)

### Error Handling
- **Null guards**: `ArgumentNullException.ThrowIfNull()` and explicit `?? throw new ArgumentNullException()`
- **PubSub**: Exceptions in message processing ‚Üí `Nack` (redelivery); validation failures ‚Üí `Ack` (discard)
- **Vertex AI**: `Google.GenAI.ClientError` 429 ‚Üí `shouldRetry = true` ‚Üí `Nack`; other errors ‚Üí no retry
- **BigQuery insert failures**: Throws `DataException` with logging
- **Cache failures**: Suppressed (`Task.CompletedTask` fallback), doesn't block processing
- **FormatData**: JSON parse failures return empty `ClinicalResponse()` (defensive)

### Validation
- `EventFile.IsValid()` ‚Äî checks required fields (Kind, Name, Bucket)
- `PubSubMessageEventHelper.IsValidMessageEventType()` ‚Äî filters `OBJECT_FINALIZE`
- `GenerateContentResponseHelper.ValidateAndExtract()` ‚Äî validates Vertex AI response chain

### Logging
- Structured logging via `ILogger<T>` with `LogTemplate` constants
- Mixed: some use structured placeholders (`{Message}`, `{Worker}`), some use string interpolation (`$"..."`) ‚Äî **inconsistent**
- Log levels: `LogInformation` for flow; `LogError` for failures; `LogWarning` for missing data

### DI Lifetimes
- All GCP services registered as **Singleton** (credential, BigQuery client, Vertex wrapper)
- `TranscriptionsCommandHandler` registered as **Transient** (new instance per request)
- `TransactionConsumerHandler` as **HostedService** (Singleton-scoped by .NET)

## 11. AI/Vertex AI Integration (Gemini)

### Model

- **Model**: `gemini-2.5-flash`
- **SDK**: `Google.GenAI` v0.6.0 (official Google SDK)
- **Vertex AI mode**: `vertexAI: true` in client constructor

### Request Configuration

```csharp
GenerateContentConfig:
  Temperature = 0.0          // Deterministic
  TopP = 0.95
  ResponseMimeType = "application/json"   // Structured output
  ThinkingConfig.ThinkingBudget = 0       // No CoT thinking
  ResponseSchema = TranscriptionSchemaResponse.Schema
  Labels = { "source_platform": "Telehealth|Emergency" }
```

### Input (Content)

```csharp
Content {
  Role = "user",
  Parts = [
    Part { FileData = { FileUri = "gs://bucket/file.webm", MimeType = "audio/mpeg" } },
    Part { Text = promptText }
  ]
}
```

Audio files are referenced by GCS URI (not uploaded inline).

### Response Schema (Structured Output)

```json
{
  "type": "OBJECT",
  "properties": {
    "transcription": { "type": "STRING" },
    "symptoms": { "type": "ARRAY", "items": { "type": "STRING" } },
    "suggestedCIDs": {
      "type": "ARRAY",
      "items": {
        "type": "OBJECT",
        "properties": {
          "code": { "type": "STRING" },
          "description": { "type": "STRING" }
        },
        "required": ["code", "description"]
      }
    }
  },
  "required": ["transcription", "symptoms", "suggestedCIDs"]
}
```

### Prompt (`PromptDefault.Anamnesis` ‚Äî ~117 lines)

Instru√ß√µes completas em portugu√™s para anamnese cl√≠nica de telemedicina:

1. **CONTEXTO**: Assistente de documenta√ß√£o m√©dica para consultas de telemedicina
2. **VALIDA√á√ÉO PR√âVIA**: Se √°udio inv√°lido/vazio ‚Üí retorna JSON com "√ÅUDIO INV√ÅLIDO"
3. **ESTRUTURA OBRIGAT√ìRIA**: QP, HMA, AP, Exame F√≠sico Referido, Conduta e Orienta√ß√µes
4. **REGRAS ABSOLUTAS**: JAMAIS inventar, ZERO interpreta√ß√£o, fidelidade absoluta
5. **LINGUAGEM**: Terminologia m√©dica formal, convers√£o leigo‚Üím√©dico
6. **PROIBI√á√ïES**: Sem diagn√≥sticos n√£o verbalizados, sem infer√™ncia cl√≠nica
7. **FIDELIDADE**: Medica√ß√µes copiadas exatamente; comorbidades expl√≠citas; alergias literais
8. **CIDs**: ‚â•5 CID-10 sempre; hierarquia: verbalizado > sindr√¥mico > administrativo

### Dynamic Prompts

O sistema suporta prompts din√¢micos via BigQuery:
- `VertexAiService.GetPromptAndPlatformAsync()` busca `promptId` e `platform` da tabela `File_Transcription`
- Depois busca o prompt text da tabela `Prompts`
- Se n√£o encontrar ‚Üí fallback para `PromptDefault.Anamnesis`

### Token Usage Tracking

Ap√≥s cada chamada, salva no BigQuery (`Token_Data`):
- `PromptTokenCount`, `CandidatesTokenCount`, `TotalTokenCount`, `ThoughtsTokenCount`
- `FinishMessage`, `FinishReason`

### Error Handling (Vertex)
- **429 Too Many Requests** ‚Üí `shouldRetry = true` ‚Üí Pub/Sub `Nack` (redelivery)
- **Other ClientErrors** ‚Üí `shouldRetry = false` ‚Üí `Ack` (discard)
- **Unexpected exceptions** ‚Üí `shouldRetry = false` ‚Üí `Ack`

## Observa√ß√µes

1. **`BaseConsumerHandler` n√£o √© utilizado** ‚Äî `TransactionConsumerHandler` herda diretamente de `BackgroundService`, n√£o de `BaseConsumerHandler`. Poss√≠vel vest√≠gio de refatora√ß√£o ou prepara√ß√£o para pattern futuro (Service Bus via MediatR).

2. **Todos os servi√ßos GCP s√£o Singleton** ‚Äî O `BigQueryClient` e o `GoogleCredential` s√£o criados uma vez e reutilizados. Isso √© correto para service account credentials.

3. **workId extraction √© fr√°gil** ‚Äî `evtFile.Name?.Split('.').FirstOrDefault()` pega tudo antes do primeiro `.`. Para arquivos em subdiret√≥rios (`PR_002/2/guid.webm`), o workId ser√° `PR_002/2/guid` (com path). O teste `ComArquivoEmSubdiretorio` espera `guid` mas o c√≥digo atual retornaria `PR_002/2/378f05bfb8364cca876310b3b1ffe35f` ‚Äî pode haver inconsist√™ncia.

4. **Sem health checks no K8s** ‚Äî O deployment n√£o tem `livenessProbe` nem `readinessProbe`, o que pode causar problemas em produ√ß√£o.

5. **Credenciais em dev appsettings** ‚Äî O `appsettings.json` cont√©m um service account completo em base64 (credenciais de dev).

6. **Mixed serialization** ‚Äî Usa `System.Text.Json` para a maioria, mas `Newtonsoft.Json` para `InsertCompletedTranscriptionAsync` (`JsonConvert.SerializeObject`).

3. `TranscriptionMessageProcessor` ‚Üí extrai workId, monta URI, chama Vertex AI
4. `VertexAiService` ‚Üí busca prompt no BigQuery (fallback: `PromptDefault.Anamnesis`), chama Gemini 2.5 Flash
5. Resultado persistido em paralelo: `Task.WhenAll(cacheTask, bigQueryTask)`

## Arquitetura

**Layered Architecture** com pastas numeradas na solution:

```
0 - Presentation    ‚Üí Api / Consumer (entry point)
1 - Domain          ‚Üí Domain (business logic, contracts, services)
2 - Infrastructure  ‚Üí Infra.Cache, Infra.Data.Queries (apenas API)
3 - Tests           ‚Üí UnitTests

### Padr√µes utilizados

- **Command/Handler** ‚Äî pares isolados command/handler via MediatR (`Hapvida.Core.Domain`)
- **Query/Handler** ‚Äî queries de leitura separadas de comandos (CQRS-lite)
- **Bootstrapper** ‚Äî `Bootstrapper.cs` est√°tico com extension methods para registro de DI
- **Wrapper** ‚Äî `BigQueryClientWrapper` (API), `VertexClientWrapper` (Consumer) para testabilidade
- **Interface segregation** ‚Äî `Contracts/v1/` com interfaces de servi√ßo granulares (`IBigQueryServiceReader`/`IBigQueryServiceWriter`)
- **API versioning** ‚Äî pastas `v1/` em todas as camadas
- **Options pattern** ‚Äî `IOptions<T>` para configura√ß√µes tipadas
- **Multi-stage Dockerfile** ‚Äî 6 stages (base ‚Üí build ‚Üí test ‚Üí build app ‚Üí publish ‚Üí final)
- **Cache-aside** ‚Äî API l√™ do cache primeiro, fallback para BigQuery, persiste no cache
- **Domain notifications** ‚Äî `IDomainContextNotifications` para erros de valida√ß√£o
- **Fail-fast** ‚Äî valida√ß√£o de config no startup com `ArgumentNullException.ThrowIfNull()`

                     ‚îÇ     { transcription, symptoms, suggestedCIDs }
                     ‚îú‚îÄ‚Üí BigQuery (persiste transcri√ß√£o em File_Transcription)
                     ‚îú‚îÄ‚Üí BigQuery (persiste token usage em Token_Data)
                     ‚îî‚îÄ‚Üí Redis Cache (consulta r√°pida)
                              ‚Üì
                        API (l√™ de Cache/BigQuery)

```

## Conven√ß√µes

1. **Namespace**: `Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.[Layer]` ‚Äî prefixo corporativo, PascalCase
2. **API versioning**: pastas `v1/` em todas as camadas
3. **Bootstrapper pattern**: `Bootstrapper.cs` est√°tico com extension methods para DI
4. **GlobalUsings.cs**: `global using` centralizado por projeto

12. **Cultures**: `pt-BR` prim√°rio, `en-US` secund√°rio

14. **Logging**: Structured logging via `ILogger<T>` com templates est√°ticos (`LogsTemplate`/`LogTemplate`)
15. **DI lifetimes**: GCP clients como Singleton, handlers como Scoped/Transient
16. **Serialization**: `System.Text.Json` prim√°rio, `Newtonsoft.Json` pontual no Consumer

v.value: Agora vou registrar as li√ß√µes aprendidas na an√°lise e propor os skills:

edits.text:
<lesson date="2026-02-10" category="arquitetura">
  <context>An√°lise profunda revelou que API e Consumer possuem enums WorkStatus com valores num√©ricos divergentes (API: Processing=0, Completed=1, Pending=2 vs Consumer: Completed=0, Pending=1). Ambos projetos s√£o independentes mas gravam/leem da mesma tabela BigQuery.</context>
  <decision>Documentar a diverg√™ncia como tech debt. Qualquer altera√ß√£o no WorkStatus deve considerar ambos os projetos e a compatibilidade com dados existentes no BigQuery.</decision>
  <outcome>Risco identificado ‚Äî mudan√ßas no enum de um projeto podem quebrar o outro silenciosamente.</outcome>
</lesson>

<lesson date="2026-02-10" category="padr√µes">
  <context>An√°lise revelou que o namespace do projeto Infra.Data.Queries da API tem typo persistente: `Hapvvida` (duplo 'v') no RootNamespace do csproj, causando inconsist√™ncia em imports.</context>
  <decision>Manter awareness do typo. Ao gerar c√≥digo referenciando Infra.Data.Queries, usar o namespace correto com `Hapvvida` (duplo v) para compilar, mas sinalizar o issue.</decision>
  <outcome>Evita erros de compila√ß√£o por namespace incorreto ao gerar c√≥digo.</outcome>
</lesson>

<lesson date="2026-02-10" category="padr√µes">
  <context>API UnitTests usa AMBOS Moq e NSubstitute no mesmo projeto. Alguns test classes usam Moq, outros NSubstitute.</context>
  <decision>Ao criar novos testes para a API, verificar qual framework o test class existente j√° usa e seguir o mesmo. Para novos test classes, preferir NSubstitute (mais recente nos testes).</decision>
  <outcome>Consist√™ncia dentro de cada test class, minimizando confus√£o.</outcome>
</lesson>

<lesson date="2026-02-10" category="arquitetura">
  <context>Consumer possui BaseConsumerHandler (herda de Hapvida.Core) que n√£o √© utilizado ‚Äî TransactionConsumerHandler herda diretamente de BackgroundService.</context>
  <decision>BaseConsumerHandler √© dead code / legado do padr√£o Service Bus do Hapvida.Core. O Consumer atual usa Pub/Sub diretamente via SubscriberClient.</decision>
  <outcome>N√£o usar BaseConsumerHandler como refer√™ncia para novos consumers neste projeto.</outcome>
</lesson>

<lesson date="2026-02-10" category="arquitetura">
  <context>API Domain.csproj exclui pasta Commands da compila√ß√£o (`Compile Remove="Commands\**"`), e Infra.Data.Queries.csproj referencia pacotes n√£o utilizados visivelmente (NAudio, Xabe.FFmpeg, Refit, System.Management).</context>
  <decision>C√≥digo em Domain/Commands pode ser vest√≠gio de refatora√ß√£o. Packages potencialmente n√£o utilizados s√£o tech debt mas n√£o devem ser removidos sem valida√ß√£o completa.</decision>
  <outcome>Awareness para n√£o referenciar esses artefatos como padr√µes a seguir.</outcome>
</lesson>

<lesson date="2026-02-10" category="tooling">
  <context>Ambos projetos usam System.Text.Json como serializa√ß√£o prim√°ria, mas Consumer usa Newtonsoft.Json pontualmente no BigQueryService.InsertCompletedTranscriptionAsync (JsonConvert.SerializeObject).</context>
  <decision>Para novas serializa√ß√µes, usar System.Text.Json (JsonSerializer) como padr√£o. Newtonsoft apenas se houver necessidade espec√≠fica documentada.</decision>
  <outcome>Consist√™ncia nas depend√™ncias de serializa√ß√£o.</outcome>
</lesson>

<lesson date="2026-02-10" category="arquitetura">
  <context>Consumer K8s deployment n√£o possui health checks (liveness/readiness probes), enquanto API possui ambos (/health e /ready).</context>
  <decision>Documentado como tech debt. Worker Services .NET podem implementar health checks via IHealthCheck + endpoints HTTP em background.</decision>
  <outcome>Risco de pods zombie em produ√ß√£o sem probes.</outcome>
</lesson>

{"filePath": "d:\Repos\_hv\STT\.github\.copilot-project\context\code-map\index.md", "content": "# Code Map

> Atualizado em: 2026-02-10

## Arquitetura

Sistema STT (Speech-To-Text) composto por dois projetos .NET 8: uma REST API para gera√ß√£o de URLs assinadas e consulta de transcri√ß√µes, e um Worker Service (Consumer) que consome eventos Pub/Sub do GCS e processa transcri√ß√µes via Vertex AI (Gemini 2.5 Flash). Ambos compartilham BigQuery e Redis como stores.

## M√≥dulos

| M√≥dulo | Arquivo do Mapa | Descri√ß√£o | Artefatos |
|--------|-----------------|-----------|-----------|
| API | [api.md](api.md) | Controllers e endpoints REST | 4 |
| Services | [services.md](services.md) | Servi√ßos de neg√≥cio e handlers | 16 |
| Models | [models.md](models.md) | Models, DTOs, interfaces de dados | 24 |
| Utils | [utils.md](utils.md) | Helpers, extensions, wrappers | 8 |
| Config | [config.md](config.md) | Enums, constantes, resources, settings | 14 |

## Depend√™ncias entre M√≥dulos

### API Project
```
Controllers ‚Üí Handlers (MediatR) ‚Üí Services ‚Üí Wrappers ‚Üí GCP SDKs
                                  ‚Üí CacheService ‚Üí Redis
```

### Consumer Project
```
TransactionConsumerHandler ‚Üí TranscriptionsCommandHandler ‚Üí MessageProcessor ‚Üí VertexAiService ‚Üí VertexClientWrapper ‚Üí Gemini
                                                          ‚Üí BigQueryService ‚Üí BigQuery
                                                          ‚Üí CacheService ‚Üí Redis
```

### Shared Patterns
- Ambos projetos usam `Bootstrapper.cs` para DI
- Ambos usam `IOptions<T>` para configura√ß√£o tipada
- Ambos usam BigQuery e Redis (com implementa√ß√µes separadas)
"}

{"filePath": "d:\Repos\_hv\STT\.github\.copilot-project\memory\lessons-learned.md", "newString": "## Registro

<!-- Adicionar li√ß√µes aqui, mais recente primeiro -->

<lesson date="2026-02-10" category="arquitetura">
  <context>An√°lise profunda revelou que API e Consumer possuem enums WorkStatus com valores num√©ricos divergentes (API: Processing=0, Completed=1, Pending=2 vs Consumer: Completed=0, Pending=1). Ambos projetos s√£o independentes mas gravam/leem da mesma tabela BigQuery.</context>
  <decision>Documentar a diverg√™ncia como tech debt. Qualquer altera√ß√£o no WorkStatus deve considerar ambos os projetos e a compatibilidade com dados existentes no BigQuery.</decision>
  <outcome>Risco identificado ‚Äî mudan√ßas no enum de um projeto podem quebrar o outro silenciosamente.</outcome>
</lesson>

<lesson date="2026-02-10" category="padr√µes">
  <context>An√°lise revelou que o namespace do projeto Infra.Data.Queries da API tem typo persistente: `Hapvvida` (duplo 'v') no RootNamespace do csproj, causando inconsist√™ncia em imports.</context>
  <decision>Manter awareness do typo. Ao gerar c√≥digo referenciando Infra.Data.Queries, usar o namespace correto com `Hapvvida` (duplo v) para compilar, mas sinalizar o issue.</decision>
  <outcome>Evita erros de compila√ß√£o por namespace incorreto ao gerar c√≥digo.</outcome>
</lesson>

<lesson date="2026-02-10" category="padr√µes">
  <context>API UnitTests usa AMBOS Moq e NSubstitute no mesmo projeto. Alguns test classes usam Moq, outros NSubstitute.</context>
  <decision>Ao criar novos testes para a API, verificar qual framework o test class existente j√° usa e seguir o mesmo. Para novos test classes, preferir NSubstitute (mais recente nos testes).</decision>
  <outcome>Consist√™ncia dentro de cada test class, minimizando confus√£o.</outcome>
</lesson>

<lesson date="2026-02-10" category="arquitetura">
  <context>Consumer possui BaseConsumerHandler (herda de Hapvida.Core) que n√£o √© utilizado ‚Äî TransactionConsumerHandler herda diretamente de BackgroundService.</context>
  <decision>BaseConsumerHandler √© dead code / legado do padr√£o Service Bus do Hapvida.Core. O Consumer atual usa Pub/Sub diretamente via SubscriberClient.</decision>
  <outcome>N√£o usar BaseConsumerHandler como refer√™ncia para novos consumers neste projeto.</outcome>
</lesson>

<lesson date="2026-02-10" category="arquitetura">
  <context>API Domain.csproj exclui pasta Commands da compila√ß√£o (`Compile Remove="Commands\**"`), e Infra.Data.Queries.csproj referencia pacotes n√£o utilizados visivelmente (NAudio, Xabe.FFmpeg, Refit, System.Management).</context>
  <decision>C√≥digo em Domain/Commands pode ser vest√≠gio de refatora√ß√£o. Packages potencialmente n√£o utilizados s√£o tech debt mas n√£o devem ser removidos sem valida√ß√£o completa.</decision>
  <outcome>Awareness para n√£o referenciar esses artefatos como padr√µes a seguir.</outcome>
</lesson>

<lesson date="2026-02-10" category="tooling">
  <context>Ambos projetos usam System.Text.Json como serializa√ß√£o prim√°ria, mas Consumer usa Newtonsoft.Json pontualmente no BigQueryService.InsertCompletedTranscriptionAsync (JsonConvert.SerializeObject).</context>

content.value:
I now have a complete picture of the entire API project. Here is the comprehensive analysis:

---

# Relat√≥rio Completo da API ‚Äî STT (Speech-To-Text)

## 1. Solution Structure

**Solution file**: [Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.sln](Api/src/Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.sln)

### Projects (5 total, organized in solution folders)

| Solution Folder | Project | Type |
|---|---|---|
| **0 - Presentation** | `Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.Api` | ASP.NET Web API (.NET 8) |
| **1 - Domain** | `Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.Domain` | Class Library (.NET 8) |
| **2 - Infrastructure** | `Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.Infra.Data.Queries` | Class Library (.NET 8) |
| **2 - Infrastructure** | `Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.Infra.Cache` | Class Library (.NET 8) |
| **3 - Tests** | `Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.UnitTests` | xUnit Test Project (.NET 8) |

### Dependency Graph

```
Api ‚Üí Domain, Infra.Data.Queries, Infra.Cache
Infra.Data.Queries ‚Üí Domain
Infra.Cache ‚Üí Domain
UnitTests ‚Üí Domain, Infra.Data.Queries, Infra.Cache
```

---

## 2. API Endpoints

### `SpeechTextController` ‚Äî Route: `api/v1/speech-text`

| Method | Route | Parameters | Description |
|---|---|---|---|
| `GET` | `/transcription` | `workId` (query, **required**) | Retrieves transcription status by workId. Cache-first, falls back to BigQuery. Returns `GetTranscriptionQueryResponse`. |
| `GET` | `/latency` | `workId` (query, optional), `dataInicio` (query, optional), `dataFim` (query, optional) | Calculates processing latency. Supports lookup by single workId or by date range. Compares GCS file creation time vs BigQuery row creation time. |

### `UrlController` ‚Äî Route: `api/v1/url`

| Method | Route | Parameters | Description |
|---|---|---|---|
| `GET` | `/signed/upload` | _(none)_ | Generates a signed GCS upload URL. Returns `{ SignedUrl, WorkId }`. |
| `POST` | `/signed/upload` | `CreateSignedUrlUploadRequest` (body: `PromptId`, `Platform`) | Generates a signed URL with prompt/platform path structure AND inserts a record into BigQuery. Returns `{ SignedUrl, WorkId, PromptId, Platform }`. |

Both controllers extend `BaseController` (from `Hapvida.Core.Api.Http`) which uses **MediatR** to dispatch queries/commands via `ExecuteAsync()`.

---

## 3. Domain Layer

### 3.1 Models (in `Domain/Models/v1/`)

| Class | Description |
|---|---|
| `GoogleCloudStorageSettings` | Options class for `Core:GoogleCloudStorage` config section. Properties: `ProjectId`, `BucketName`, `CredentialsBase64`, `UrlExpirationMinutes` (default 15), `DefaultUploadContentType`, `DefaultExtension`, `GoogleBigQuery` (nested). |
| `GoogleBigQueryOptionsSettings` | Nested settings: `DataSet`, `Table`. |
| `GoogleCloudStorageFile` | Record: `Name`, `CreatedAt` (DateTimeOffset?), `Size` (ulong?). |
| `GetTranscriptionOnBigQueryResponse` | `FileName`, `EncounterId`, `Transcription`, `Symptoms`, `SuggestedCIDs`, `WorkStatus` (enum), `ReadyFields`, `CreatedAt`. |
| `GetTranscriptionQueryResponse` | `EncounterId`, `Transcription`, `Symptoms`, `SuggestedCIDs`, `WorkStatus`, `CreatedAt`. JSON property names annotated. |
| `GetSignedUrlUploadResponse` | `SignedUrl`, `WorkId`. (Note: in namespace `Hapvvida` ‚Äî typo.) |

### 3.2 DTOs (in `Domain/Dtos/`)

| Class | Properties |
|---|---|
| `ConsultaStatusDto` | `WorkId`, `EncounterId`, `Transcription`, `Symptoms` (List\<string\>), `SuggestedCIDs` (List\<SuggestedCid\>), `WorkStatus` (enum), `CreatedAt`. |
| `RowDto` | `WorkId`, `EncounterId`, `Symptoms`, `Transcription`, `SuggestedCIDs`, `WorkStatus`, `ReadyFields`, `CreatedAt`. Used internally by BigQuery wrapper. |
| `SuggestedCid` | `Code`, `Description`. JSON property names annotated. |
| `SignedUrlRecordDto` | `WorkId`, `PromptId`, `Platform`, `SignedUrl`, `CreatedAt`. Used for BigQuery inserts. |
| `TranscriptionSummaryDto` | `WorkId`, `CreatedAt`. Lightweight DTO for latency calculations. |
| `LatencyRowDto` | `WorkId`, `FileName`, `BigQueryCreatedAtUtc`. |
| `ProcessingLatencyItemDto` | `FileName`, `BucketCreatedAt`, `BigQueryCreatedAt`, `SizeInMb`, `LatencySeconds`. |

### 3.3 Enums

| Enum | Values |
|---|---|
| `WorkStatus` | `Processing = 0`, `Completed = 1`, `Pending = 2` |
| `TimeToExpireTokenType` | `DefaultTime = 1`, `SystemParameter = 2`, `SystemRegister = 3` |

### 3.4 Contracts/Interfaces

**Services** (`Domain/Contracts/v1/Services/`):

| Interface | Methods |
|---|---|
| `IBigQueryServiceReader` | `GetLatestByWorkIdAsync(string workId, CancellationToken)` ‚Üí `ConsultaStatusDto?`; `GetTranscriptionsByPeriodAsync(DateTimeOffset start, end, CancellationToken)` ‚Üí `IReadOnlyList<TranscriptionSummaryDto>`; `GetLatestTranscriptionByWorkIdAsync(string workId, CancellationToken)` ‚Üí `TranscriptionSummaryDto?` |
| `IBigQueryServiceWriter` | `InsertSignedUrlRecordAsync(SignedUrlRecordDto record, CancellationToken)` ‚Üí `bool` |
| `ICacheService` | `GetCacheAsync(string key, CancellationToken)` ‚Üí `string`; `SetCacheAsync(key, value, CancellationToken)`; `SetCacheAsync(key, value, TimeToExpireTokenType, CancellationToken)` |
| `IGenerateUrlSignedService` | `GenerateForUploadAsync()` ‚Üí `(string signedUrl, string workId)`; `GenerateForUploadAsync(string prompt, string platform)` ‚Üí `(string signedUrl, string workId)` |
| `IGoogleCloudStorageService` | `GetObjectAsync(string objectName, CancellationToken)` ‚Üí `GoogleCloudStorageFile?`; `ListByCreatedAtAsync(DateTimeOffset? from, to, CancellationToken)` ‚Üí `IReadOnlyList<GoogleCloudStorageFile>` |

**Wrappers** (`Domain/Contracts/v1/Wrappers/`):

| Interface | Methods |
|---|---|
| `IBigQueryClientWrapper` | `ExecuteQueryAsync(string sql, BigQueryParameter[], QueryOptions?, CancellationToken)` ‚Üí `IEnumerable<RowDto>` |

### 3.5 Services (implementations in `Domain/Services/v1/`)

| Class | Implements | Description |
|---|---|---|
| `BigQueryCheckStatusService` | `IBigQueryServiceReader` | Queries BigQuery for transcription status. **3 methods**: lookup by workId (full status), lookup by workId (summary only), and batch lookup by date period. Uses parameterized SQL with `@workId`, `@startDate`, `@endDate`. Delegates to `IBigQueryClientWrapper`. |
| `BigQueryWriterService` | `IBigQueryServiceWriter` | Inserts signed URL records into BigQuery via `INSERT INTO` SQL. Parameters: workId, promptId, platform, signedUrl, createdAt, workStatus="Processing". Returns `false` on error (does not throw). |
| `GenerateUrlSignedService` | `IGenerateUrlSignedService` | Creates Google Cloud Storage signed URLs for upload using `UrlSigner`. Decodes Base64 credentials at construction. Object naming: no-prompt ‚Üí `{workId}.webm`; with-prompt ‚Üí `{prompt}/{platform}/{workId}.webm`. Expiration: 30 minutes. |
| `GoogleCloudStorageService` | `IGoogleCloudStorageService` | Uses `StorageClient` with read-only scope. `GetObjectAsync` fetches a single GCS object by name (+.webm). `ListByCreatedAtAsync` lists ALL bucket objects and filters by date range client-side. |

### 3.6 Wrappers

| Class | Implements | Description |
|---|---|---|
| `BigQueryClientWrapper` | `IBigQueryClientWrapper` | Wraps `BigQueryClient.ExecuteQueryAsync()`. Maps row results to `RowDto` using `BigQueryRowExtensions` helper. Handles JSON-encoded `suggestedCIDs` field. Determines `WorkStatus` from string "completed". |

### 3.7 Helpers

| Class | Description |
|---|---|
| `BigQueryRowExtensions` | Static extension methods for `BigQueryRow`: `TryGetValue()`, `Get<T>()`, `GetArray<T>()`, `GetJsonArray<TOut>()` (handles JSON strings and repeated fields), `GetPropString()` for `JsonElement`. |

### 3.8 Resources

| Class | Description |
|---|---|
| `Constants` | `InfoAudioFile`, `InfoJsonDeserializedParent`, `InfoJsonDeserializedChild` |
| `LogsTemplate` | Structured log templates: `StartHandler`, `InfoHandler`, `EndHandler`, `TraceHandler`, `ErrorHandler`, `WarningHandler` |
| `Message` | User-facing messages (Portuguese): `WorkIdRequired`, `TranscriptionNotFound`, `Pending`, `GettingFromCache`, `AddingToCache`, `GettingFromBigQuery`, `DateByPeriodRequired`, `DataInicioGreaterThanDataFim` |

---

## 4. Infrastructure Layer (Infra.Data.Queries)

### 4.1 Queries (MediatR Query Handlers)

#### `GetTranscriptionQuery` / `GetTranscriptionHandler`
- **Input**: `GetTranscriptionQuery(string WorkId)` extends `Query`
- **Flow**: Validate workId ‚Üí Try cache ‚Üí If miss, query BigQuery via `IBigQueryServiceReader.GetLatestByWorkIdAsync` ‚Üí Map to `GetTranscriptionQueryResponse` via AutoMapper ‚Üí Cache result ‚Üí Return
- **Cache strategy**: Read-through with `JsonSerializer`

#### `GetSignedUrlUploadQuery` / `GetSignedUrlUploadHandler`  
- **Input**: `GetSignedUrlUploadQuery()` (no parameters)
- **Flow**: Call `IGenerateUrlSignedService.GenerateForUploadAsync()` ‚Üí Return `GetSignedUrlUploadResponse { SignedUrl, WorkId }`

#### `GetProcessingLatencyQuery` / `GetProcessingLatencyHandler`
- **Input**: `GetProcessingLatencyQuery(string? WorkId, DateTime? DataInicio, DateTime? DataFim)` with helpers `IsByWorkId`, `IsByPeriod`
- **Flow**: Validate parameters ‚Üí If by period: GCS `ListByCreatedAtAsync` + BigQuery `GetTranscriptionsByPeriodAsync` ‚Üí correlate by workId, calculate latency. If by workId: GCS `GetObjectAsync` + BigQuery `GetLatestTranscriptionByWorkIdAsync` ‚Üí calculate single item latency.
- **Output**: `GetProcessingLatencyResponse { DataInicio, DataFim, Itens: List<ProcessingLatencyItemDto> }`

### 4.2 Commands

#### `CreateSignedUrlUploadCommand` / `CreateSignedUrlUploadHandler`
- **Input**: `CreateSignedUrlUploadCommand(string Prompt, string Platform)` extends `Command`
- **Request DTO**: `CreateSignedUrlUploadRequest { PromptId [Required], Platform [Required] }`
- **Flow**: `IGenerateUrlSignedService.GenerateForUploadAsync(prompt, platform)` ‚Üí `IBigQueryServiceWriter.InsertSignedUrlRecordAsync(record)` ‚Üí Return `CreateSignedUrlUploadResponse { SignedUrl, WorkId, PromptId, Platform }`
- **Resilience**: If BigQuery insert fails, still returns the signed URL (logs warning)

### 4.3 AutoMappers

| Profile | Mappings |
|---|---|
| `MappingProfiles` | `ConsultaStatusDto` ‚Üí `GetTranscriptionOnBigQueryResponse`; `ConsultaStatusDto` ‚Üí `GetTranscriptionQueryResponse` |

---

## 5. Infra.Cache Layer

### Models
- **`CacheSettings`**: Options class for `Core:Cache`. Properties: `ConnectionString`, `InstanceName`, `MinutesToExpireToken` (Dictionary\<string, int\>). Method `GetOptions(TimeToExpireTokenType)` returns `DistributedCacheEntryOptions` with absolute expiration.

### Services
- **`CacheService`** (`ICacheService`): Wraps `IDistributedCache` (Redis via StackExchange). `GetCacheAsync` swallows exceptions ‚Üí returns empty string. `SetCacheAsync` swallows exceptions ‚Üí logs error. Default expiration uses `TimeToExpireTokenType.DefaultTime`.

---

## 6. Dependency Injection (Bootstrapper.cs)

[Bootstrapper.cs](Api/src/Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.Api/Bootstrapper.cs) registers:

| Service | Implementation | Lifetime |
|---|---|---|
| `IGenerateUrlSignedService` | `GenerateUrlSignedService` | Scoped |
| `IBigQueryServiceReader` | `BigQueryCheckStatusService` | Scoped |
| `IBigQueryServiceWriter` | `BigQueryWriterService` | Scoped |
| `IBigQueryClientWrapper` | `BigQueryClientWrapper` | Singleton |
| `IGoogleCloudStorageService` | `GoogleCloudStorageService` | Singleton |
| `ICacheService` | `CacheService` | Singleton |
| SwaggerGenOptions | `ServerUrlDocumentFilter` | ‚Äî |
| Redis `IDistributedCache` | `AddStackExchangeRedisCache` | ‚Äî |

**Validation at startup**: The Bootstrapper validates all required GCS and Cache settings with `ArgumentNullException.ThrowIfNull()`, failing fast if any config is missing.

**Program.cs additional registrations** (via `Hapvida.Core` packages):
- `AddAppContext<Program>` ‚Äî Core API setup (controllers, Swagger, health checks, etc.)
- `AddDomainContext` ‚Äî MediatR, AutoMapper scanning of assemblies listed in `Core:Domain:Assemblies`
- `AddOpenTelemetryContext` ‚Äî OpenTelemetry with OTLP exporter
- Kestrel configuration from `Core:Kestrel`

---

## 7. Configuration

### appsettings.json structure

```
Core:
  Application:
    Name: "Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.Api"
    Version: "1.0"
    SupportedCultures: ["pt-BR", "en-US"]
  Domain:
    Assemblies: ["...Domain", "...Infra.Data.Queries"]  ‚Üê for MediatR/AutoMapper scanning
  Telemetry:
    ConnectionString: "http://localhost:4317"  (OTLP)
    MinimumLevel: "Debug"
  Cache:
    ConnectionString: "localhost:6379"
    InstanceName: "Hapvida"
    MinutesToExpireToken:
      DefaultTime: 2
      SystemParameter: 60
      SystemRegister: 60
  GoogleCloudStorage:
    ProjectId, BucketName, CredentialsBase64 (Base64 JSON SA key)
    UrlExpirationMinutes: 15
    DefaultUploadContentType: "video/webm"
    DefaultExtension: ".webm"
    GoogleBigQuery:
      Dataset: "bigquery_dataset"
      Table: "File_Transcription"
  Kestrel:
    Limits:
      MaxRequestBodySize: 62914560 (60MB)
      KeepAliveTimeout: "00:05:00"
      RequestHeadersTimeout: "00:02:00"
```

---

## 8. NuGet Packages

### Internal (Hapvida.*) ‚Äî from private Azure Artifacts feed

| Package | Version | Project |
|---|---|---|
| `Hapvida.Core.Api.Http` | 2.1.2 | Api |
| `Hapvida.Core.Domain` | 2.1.1 | Domain |
| `Hapvida.Core.Infra.OpenTelemetry.Exporter.Collector` | 2.1.0 | Domain |
| `Hapvida.Core.Infra.Services.Http` | 2.1.0 | Infra.Data.Queries |

### External

| Package | Version | Project |
|---|---|---|
| `Google.Cloud.BigQuery.V2` | 3.11.0 | Domain |
| `Google.Cloud.Storage.V1` | 4.13.0 | Domain, Infra.Data.Queries |
| `Google.Apis.Auth` | 1.71.0 | Infra.Data.Queries |
| `Microsoft.Extensions.Caching.StackExchangeRedis` | 8.0.7 | Domain |
| `Microsoft.Extensions.Caching.Abstractions` | 8.0.0 | Infra.Cache |
| `NAudio` | 2.2.1 | Domain |
| `System.Text.Json` | 10.0.0-rc.1 | Domain |
| `Newtonsoft.Json` | 13.0.4 | Infra.Data.Queries |
| `Refit` | 8.0.0 | Infra.Data.Queries |
| `System.Management` | 10.0.0-rc.1 | Infra.Data.Queries |
| `Xabe.FFmpeg` | 6.0.2 | Infra.Data.Queries |
| `Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting` | 8.0.1 | Infra.Data.Queries |
| **Test packages** | | |
| `xunit` | 2.9.0 | UnitTests |
| `xunit.runner.visualstudio` | 2.8.2 | UnitTests |
| `Moq` | 4.20.70 | UnitTests |
| `NSubstitute` | 5.3.0 | UnitTests |
| `Bogus` | 35.5.1 | UnitTests |
| `coverlet.collector` | 6.0.2 | UnitTests |
| `Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk` | 17.10.0 | UnitTests |

---

## 9. Unit Tests

### Test Classes (8 total)

| Test Class | Target | Pattern | Framework |
|---|---|---|---|
| `CreateSignedUrlUploadHandlerTests` | `CreateSignedUrlUploadHandler` | 5 tests: success, BigQuery failure resilience, exception propagation, parameterized inputs | NSubstitute + xUnit |
| `GetTranscriptionHandlerTests` | `GetTranscriptionHandler` | 5 tests: validation, cache hit, BigQuery hit + cache set, BigQuery miss, cancellation | NSubstitute + AutoMapper + xUnit |
| `GetProcessingLatencyHandlerTests` | `GetProcessingLatencyHandler` | 3 tests: validation error, period-based latency calc, workId-based latency calc | Moq + xUnit |
| `GetBigQueryCheckStatusServiceTests` | `BigQueryCheckStatusService` | 7 tests: ctor validation, empty workId, cancellation, no results, data mapping, date normalization, exception propagation | NSubstitute + xUnit |
| `BigQueryWriterServiceTests` | `BigQueryWriterService` | 6 tests: ctor validation, empty workId, cancellation, success, exception returns false, all parameters sent | NSubstitute + xUnit |
| `GenerateUrlSignedServiceTests` | `GenerateUrlSignedService` | 7 tests: null checks, missing config, invalid Base64, conditional tests gated by `GCS_TEST_SA_B64` env var | Moq + xUnit |
| `CacheServiceTests` | `CacheService` | 3 tests: get value, get exception ‚Üí empty, set exception ‚Üí suppressed + logged | NSubstitute + xUnit |
| `BigQueryRowExtensionsTests` | `BigQueryRowExtensions` | 7 tests: basic type, repeated type, JSON repeated type, `GetPropString` variations | xUnit |

**Notable patterns**:
- Mix of **Moq** and **NSubstitute** (inconsistent ‚Äî both are referenced)
- `[Fact]` and `[Theory]` with `[InlineData]`

## 14. Code Patterns & Observations

### Architecture
- **Layered architecture**: Presentation ‚Üí Domain ‚Üí Infrastructure, with proper dependency inversion (interfaces in Domain, implementations in Infra)
- **CQRS-lite** via MediatR (`Query`/`Command` base classes from `Hapvida.Core.Domain`)
- **Cache-aside pattern** in `GetTranscriptionHandler`

### Naming
- **Namespaces**: `Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.*` ‚Äî however there's a **persistent typo**: `Hapvvida` (double 'v') in `Infra.Data.Queries` namespace (`RootNamespace` in csproj is `Hapvvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.Infra.Data.Queries`)
- **Versioned folders**: `v1/` throughout all layers
- **Portuguese** in messages/logs, English in code

### Error Handling
- Constructor validation with `ArgumentNullException.ThrowIfNull()` and `throw new InvalidOperationException()`
- Domain notifications via `IDomainContextNotifications.Add()` with `NotificationType.ValidationError`
- `CancellationToken` checked explicitly at handler entry points
- Cache operations swallow exceptions (resilient)
- BigQueryWriter returns `false` on failure rather than throwing

### Logging
- Structured logging throughout with `ILogger<T>`
- Consistent template usage via `LogsTemplate` static class
- Levels: Information (start/end), Debug (trace), Warning (validation/cancel), Critical (unexpected errors), Error (cache/BigQuery failures)

#### [TranscriptionMessageProcessor.cs](Consumer/src/Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.Ai.Domain/Services/v1/TranscriptionMessageProcessor.cs)

N√∫cleo do processamento. `ProcessAsync()` flow:

1. **Desserializa** JSON ‚Üí `EventFile` via `EventFileHelper`
2. **Extrai workId** do nome do arquivo: `evtFile.Name?.Split('.').FirstOrDefault()`
3. **Monta URI**: `gs://{bucket}/{name}`
4. **Chama Vertex AI**: `_vertexAiService.SendForTranscriptionAsync(uri, credential, messageId, workId)`
5. **Retry logic**: Se `shouldRetry == true` (HTTP 429), retorna `Nack`
6. **Desserializa resposta** em `ClinicalResponse` via `FormatData()`
7. **Persiste em paralelo**: `Task.WhenAll(cacheTask, bigQueryTask)`
   - Cache: `_cacheService.SetCacheAsync(workId, contents)`
   - BigQuery: `_bigQueryService.InsertCompletedTranscriptionAsync(workId, clinicalResponse, messageId)`
8. **Error handling**: Se BigQuery falha ‚Üí `Nack`; Se Cache falha ‚Üí ignora

#### [VertexAiService.cs](Consumer/src/Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.Ai.Domain/Services/v1/VertexAiService.cs)

`SendForTranscriptionAsync()` flow:

1. **Valida** URI e Endpoint
2. **Busca prompt e platform** via `GetPromptAndPlatformAsync()`:
   - Consulta BigQuery ‚Üí `_bigQueryService.GetPromptByWorkIdAsync(workId)`
   - Se n√£o encontra ‚Üí usa `PromptDefault.Anamnesis` + `SourcePlatform.Telehealth`
3. **Monta request**:

   - `GenerateContentConfig` com `Temperature = 0.0`, `TopP = 0.95`, `ResponseMimeType = "application/json"`
   - `ThinkingConfig.ThinkingBudget = 0` (desabilita thinking)
   - `ResponseSchema = TranscriptionSchemaResponse.Schema` (structured output)
   - `Labels = SourcePlatformHelper.ToLabels(platform)`
4. **Chama** `_vertexClientWrapper.GenerateAsync(model, contents, config, credential, options)`
5. **Error handling**:

   - Outras `ClientError` ‚Üí `shouldRetry = false`
   - Exception gen√©rica ‚Üí `shouldRetry = false`
6. **Persiste metadata** em BigQuery: `InsertUsageMetadataAsync(workId, messageId, tokenData)`

### Test Patterns
- **AAA pattern** (Arrange/Act/Assert)
- Mocks via `Mock<T>()` with `.Setup()` and `.Verify()` with `Times.Once`/`Times.Never`
- Uses the testable constructor of `TranscriptionsCommandHandler` that accepts `Task<SubscriberClient>` directly
- `IVertexClientWrapper` abstracts away the HTTP call, allowing mock
- `GoogleCredentialProviderTests` builds fake service account JSON to test credential creation

## 10. Code Patterns

### Naming
- **Namespaces**: `Hapvida.TI.VoiceTranscription.Ai.{Layer}.{Folder}.v1`
- **Files**: PascalCase, matching class names
- **Versioning**: `v1` folders in every layer (Consumers, Commands, Contracts, Models, Services, Wrappers)
- **Settings classes**: `{Feature}Settings` (PubSubSettings, BigQuerySettings, VertexSettings)

### Error Handling
- **Null guards**: `ArgumentNullException.ThrowIfNull()` and explicit `?? throw new ArgumentNullException()`
- **PubSub**: Exceptions in message processing ‚Üí `Nack` (redelivery); validation failures ‚Üí `Ack` (discard)
- **Vertex AI**: `Google.GenAI.ClientError` 429 ‚Üí `shouldRetry = true` ‚Üí `Nack`; other errors ‚Üí no retry
- **BigQuery insert failures**: Throws `DataException` with logging
- **Cache failures**: Suppressed (`Task.CompletedTask` fallback), doesn't block processing
- **FormatData**: JSON parse failures return empty `ClinicalResponse()` (defensive)

### Validation
- `EventFile.IsValid()` ‚Äî checks required fields (Kind, Name, Bucket)
- `PubSubMessageEventHelper.IsValidMessageEventType()` ‚Äî filters `OBJECT_FINALIZE`
- `GenerateContentResponseHelper.ValidateAndExtract()` ‚Äî validates Vertex AI response chain

### Logging
- Structured logging via `ILogger<T>` with `LogTemplate` constants
- Mixed: some use structured placeholders (`{Message}`, `{Worker}`), some use string interpolation (`$"..."`) ‚Äî **inconsistent**
- Log levels: `LogInformation` for flow; `LogError` for failures; `LogWarning` for missing data

### DI Lifetimes
- All GCP services registered as **Singleton** (credential, BigQuery client, Vertex wrapper)
- `TranscriptionsCommandHandler` registered as **Transient** (new instance per request)
- `TransactionConsumerHandler` as **HostedService** (Singleton-scoped by .NET)

## 11. AI/Vertex AI Integration (Gemini)

### Model

- **Model**: `gemini-2.5-flash`
- **SDK**: `Google.GenAI` v0.6.0 (official Google SDK)
- **Vertex AI mode**: `vertexAI: true` in client constructor

### Request Configuration

```csharp
GenerateContentConfig:
  Temperature = 0.0          // Deterministic
  TopP = 0.95
  ResponseMimeType = "application/json"   // Structured output
  ThinkingConfig.ThinkingBudget = 0       // No CoT thinking
  ResponseSchema = TranscriptionSchemaResponse.Schema
  Labels = { "source_platform": "Telehealth|Emergency" }
```

### Input (Content)

```csharp
Content {
  Role = "user",
  Parts = [
    Part { FileData = { FileUri = "gs://bucket/file.webm", MimeType = "audio/mpeg" } },
    Part { Text = promptText }
  ]
}
```

Audio files are referenced by GCS URI (not uploaded inline).

### Response Schema (Structured Output)

```json
{
  "type": "OBJECT",
  "properties": {
    "transcription": { "type": "STRING" },
    "symptoms": { "type": "ARRAY", "items": { "type": "STRING" } },
    "suggestedCIDs": {
      "type": "ARRAY",
      "items": {
        "type": "OBJECT",
        "properties": {
          "code": { "type": "STRING" },
          "description": { "type": "STRING" }
        },
        "required": ["code", "description"]
      }
    }
  },
  "required": ["transcription", "symptoms", "suggestedCIDs"]
}
```

### Prompt (`PromptDefault.Anamnesis` ‚Äî ~117 lines)

Instru√ß√µes completas em portugu√™s para anamnese cl√≠nica de telemedicina:

1. **CONTEXTO**: Assistente de documenta√ß√£o m√©dica para consultas de telemedicina
2. **VALIDA√á√ÉO PR√âVIA**: Se √°udio inv√°lido/vazio ‚Üí retorna JSON com "√ÅUDIO INV√ÅLIDO"
3. **ESTRUTURA OBRIGAT√ìRIA**: QP, HMA, AP, Exame F√≠sico Referido, Conduta e Orienta√ß√µes
4. **REGRAS ABSOLUTAS**: JAMAIS inventar, ZERO interpreta√ß√£o, fidelidade absoluta
5. **LINGUAGEM**: Terminologia m√©dica formal, convers√£o leigo‚Üím√©dico
6. **PROIBI√á√ïES**: Sem diagn√≥sticos n√£o verbalizados, sem infer√™ncia cl√≠nica
7. **FIDELIDADE**: Medica√ß√µes copiadas exatamente; comorbidades expl√≠citas; alergias literais
8. **CIDs**: ‚â•5 CID-10 sempre; hierarquia: verbalizado > sindr√¥mico > administrativo

### Dynamic Prompts

O sistema suporta prompts din√¢micos via BigQuery:
- `VertexAiService.GetPromptAndPlatformAsync()` busca `promptId` e `platform` da tabela `File_Transcription`
- Depois busca o prompt text da tabela `Prompts`
- Se n√£o encontrar ‚Üí fallback para `PromptDefault.Anamnesis`

### Token Usage Tracking

Ap√≥s cada chamada, salva no BigQuery (`Token_Data`):
- `PromptTokenCount`, `CandidatesTokenCount`, `TotalTokenCount`, `ThoughtsTokenCount`
- `FinishMessage`, `FinishReason`

### Error Handling (Vertex)
- **429 Too Many Requests** ‚Üí `shouldRetry = true` ‚Üí Pub/Sub `Nack` (redelivery)
- **Other ClientErrors** ‚Üí `shouldRetry = false` ‚Üí `Ack` (discard)
- **Unexpected exceptions** ‚Üí `shouldRetry = false` ‚Üí `Ack`

## Observa√ß√µes

1. **`BaseConsumerHandler` n√£o √© utilizado** ‚Äî `TransactionConsumerHandler` herda diretamente de `BackgroundService`, n√£o de `BaseConsumerHandler`. Poss√≠vel vest√≠gio de refatora√ß√£o ou prepara√ß√£o para pattern futuro (Service Bus via MediatR).

2. **Todos os servi√ßos GCP s√£o Singleton** ‚Äî O `BigQueryClient` e o `GoogleCredential` s√£o criados uma vez e reutilizados. Isso √© correto para service account credentials.

3. **workId extraction √© fr√°gil** ‚Äî `evtFile.Name?.Split('.').FirstOrDefault()` pega tudo antes do primeiro `.`. Para arquivos em subdiret√≥rios (`PR_002/2/guid.webm`), o workId ser√° `PR_002/2/guid` (com path). O teste `ComArquivoEmSubdiretorio` espera `guid` mas o c√≥digo atual retornaria `PR_002/2/378f05bfb8364cca876310b3b1ffe35f` ‚Äî pode haver inconsist√™ncia.

4. **Sem health checks no K8s** ‚Äî O deployment n√£o tem `livenessProbe` nem `readinessProbe`, o que pode causar problemas em produ√ß√£o.

5. **Credenciais em dev appsettings** ‚Äî O `appsettings.json` cont√©m um service account completo em base64 (credenciais de dev).

6. **Mixed serialization** ‚Äî Usa `System.Text.Json` para a maioria, mas `Newtonsoft.Json` para `InsertCompletedTranscriptionAsync` (`JsonConvert.SerializeObject`).

name: bigquery-query

Use ao criar novas consultas, inserts ou altera√ß√µes no BigQuery.   version: "1.0"
  category: data

# BigQuery Query Generator

Gera queries e servi√ßos BigQuery seguindo os padr√µes do projeto STT.

## Quando Usar

- Criar nova query de leitura no BigQuery
- Criar novo insert no BigQuery
- Criar novo m√©todo em BigQueryService (Consumer) ou BigQueryCheckStatusService/BigQueryWriterService (API)
- Trabalhar com tabelas `File_Transcription`, `Token_Data` ou `Prompts`

## Tabelas BigQuery

| Tabela | Dataset | Prop√≥sito | Usado por |
|--------|---------|-----------|-----------|
| `File_Transcription` | `bigquery_dataset` | Transcri√ß√µes, status, CIDs, sintomas | API (read/write), Consumer (write) |
| `Token_Data` | `bigquery_dataset` | Metadata de uso de tokens Gemini | Consumer (write) |
| `Prompts` | `bigquery_dataset` | Prompts customizados | Consumer (read) |

## Padr√µes por Projeto

### API ‚Äî Wrapper Pattern

A API usa `IBigQueryClientWrapper` que abstrai o `BigQueryClient`:

```csharp
// Interface do wrapper
public interface IBigQueryClientWrapper
{
    Task<IEnumerable<RowDto>> ExecuteQueryAsync(
        string sql,
        BigQueryParameter[] parameters,
        QueryOptions? options = null,
        CancellationToken cancellationToken = default);
}
```

**Service chama wrapper ‚Üí wrapper executa ‚Üí retorna `IEnumerable<RowDto>`**

```csharp
// No service
var parameters = new[]
{
    new BigQueryParameter("workId", BigQueryDbType.String, workId)
};

var results = await _bigQueryClientWrapper.ExecuteQueryAsync(
    sql, parameters, null, cancellationToken: ct);

var row = results.FirstOrDefault();
```

### Consumer ‚Äî BigQueryClient direto

O Consumer usa `BigQueryClient` diretamente no `BigQueryService`:

```csharp
var credential = _credentialProvider.GetCredential();
var client = BigQueryClient.Create(_settings.ProjectId, credential);
await client.ExecuteQueryAsync(sql, parameters, cancellationToken: ct);
```

## Padr√µes de SQL

### 1. Fully qualified table name

```csharp
var tableFq = $"`{_settings.ProjectId}.{bq.DataSet}.{bq.Table}`";
```

### 2. SQL template com string.Format

```csharp
const string sqlTemplate = @"
    SELECT workId, createdAt
    FROM {0}
    WHERE workId = @workId
    ORDER BY createdAt DESC
    LIMIT 1";

var sql = string.Format(sqlTemplate, tableFq);
```

### 3. Par√¢metros tipados

```csharp
var parameters = new[]
{
    new BigQueryParameter("workId", BigQueryDbType.String, workId),
    new BigQueryParameter("startDate", BigQueryDbType.Timestamp, start.UtcDateTime),
    new BigQueryParameter("endDate", BigQueryDbType.Timestamp, end.UtcDateTime)
};
```

### 4. INSERT

```csharp
const string sqlTemplate = @"
    INSERT INTO {0} (workId, encounterId, transcription, workStatus, createdAt)
    VALUES (@workId, @encounterId, @transcription, @workStatus, @createdAt)";
```

### 5. Mapeamento de resultados (API ‚Äî via RowDto)

```csharp
private static ConsultaStatusDto MapToConsultaStatusDto(RowDto row, string workId)
{
    return new ConsultaStatusDto
    {
        WorkId = row.WorkId,
        EncounterId = row.EncounterId,
        Transcription = row.Transcription,
        WorkStatus = row.WorkStatus,
        CreatedAt = row.CreatedAt
    };
}
```

### 6. Extens√µes de BigQueryRow

Usar `BigQueryRowExtensions` para extra√ß√£o tipada:

```csharp
row.Get<string>("workId")       // campo string
row.Get<DateTime>("createdAt")  // campo timestamp
row.GetJsonArray<SuggestedCid>("suggestedCIDs")  // JSON ou repeated
```

## Error Handling

| Projeto | Comportamento |
|---------|--------------|
| **API Reader** | try/catch com `LogCritical` + rethrow |
| **API Writer** | try/catch ‚Üí retorna `false` (n√£o propaga) |
| **Consumer** | try/catch ‚Üí throws `DataException` |

## Conven√ß√µes

| Regra | Padr√£o |
|-------|--------|
| SQL | SEMPRE parametrizado (`@param`, nunca concatena√ß√£o) |
| Table ref | Fully qualified com backticks: `` `project.dataset.table` `` |
| Template | `const string sqlTemplate` com `string.Format` |
| Logging | Log antes da query, log do resultado, log em caso de erro |
| CancellationToken | Sempre propagado para `ExecuteQueryAsync` |
| Dates | Converter para UTC: `start.UtcDateTime` |

## Checklist

- [ ] SQL parametrizado (nunca string interpolation para valores)
- [ ] Table name fully qualified
- [ ] BigQueryParameter com tipo correto (String, Timestamp, Int64)
- [ ] CancellationToken propagado
- [ ] Logging antes e depois da query
- [ ] Error handling seguindo padr√£o do projeto (Reader: rethrow, Writer: return bool)
- [ ] Mapeamento via RowDto/Extensions
", "filePath": "d:\Repos\_hv\STT\.github\.copilot-project\skills\bigquery-query\SKILL.md"}

# Vertex AI Prompt Manager

Gerencia prompts e configura√ß√µes do Gemini 2.5 Flash para transcri√ß√£o de √°udio m√©dico.

## Quando Usar

- Criar ou modificar prompts de transcri√ß√£o
- Alterar configura√ß√£o da chamada ao Gemini
- Modificar schema de resposta
- Adicionar novo tipo de prompt (nova plataforma)
- Trabalhar com a integra√ß√£o Vertex AI

## Arquitetura da Integra√ß√£o

```
VertexAiService
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ GetPromptAndPlatformAsync()     ‚Üí Busca prompt customizado no BigQuery
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Fallback: PromptDefault.Anamnesis
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Monta Content[] (audio + prompt)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Monta GenerateContentConfig
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Chama VertexClientWrapper.GenerateAsync()
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trata erros (429 ‚Üí retry, outros ‚Üí fail)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Persiste token usage no BigQuery
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Valida e extrai resposta via Helper
```

## Configura√ß√µes Fixas

| Par√¢metro | Valor | Motivo |
|-----------|-------|--------|
| `Temperature` | `0.0` | Determin√≠stico ‚Äî transcri√ß√£o m√©dica exige fidelidade |
| `TopP` | `0.95` | Alto ‚Äî permite vocabul√°rio m√©dico amplo |
| `ResponseMimeType` | `application/json` | Structured output obrigat√≥rio |
| `ThinkingBudget` | `0` | CoT desabilitado ‚Äî foco em velocidade |
| `Model` | `gemini-2.5-flash` | Modelo padr√£o |

> ‚ö†Ô∏è **NUNCA** alterar Temperature acima de 0. Transcri√ß√£o m√©dica n√£o tolera varia√ß√£o.

## Response Schema

O schema √© definido em `TranscriptionSchemaResponse.Schema` e segue este formato:

```json
{
  "type": "OBJECT",
  "properties": {
    "transcription": { "type": "STRING" },
    "symptoms": {
      "type": "ARRAY",
      "items": { "type": "STRING" }
    },
    "suggestedCIDs": {
      "type": "ARRAY",
      "items": {
        "type": "OBJECT",
        "properties": {
          "code": { "type": "STRING" },
          "description": { "type": "STRING" }
        },
        "required": ["code", "description"]
      }
    }
  },
  "required": ["transcription", "symptoms", "suggestedCIDs"]
}
```

Para alterar o schema, editar `Domain/Models/v1/TranscriptionSchemaResponse.cs` usando tipos do `Google.GenAI.Types`:

```csharp
using Google.GenAI.Types;
using SchemaType = Google.GenAI.Types.Type;

public static readonly Schema Schema = new Schema
{
    Type = SchemaType.OBJECT,
    Properties = new Dictionary<string, Schema>
    {
        ["campo"] = new Schema { Type = SchemaType.STRING }
    },
    Required = new List<string> { "campo" }
};
```

## Input (Content)

```csharp
Content contents = new Content
{
    Role = "user",
    Parts = new List<Part>
    {
        new Part { FileData = new FileData { FileUri = "gs://bucket/file.webm", MimeType = "audio/mpeg" } },
        new Part { Text = promptText }
    }
};
```

- **FileData**: Sempre refer√™ncia GCS por URI (nunca upload inline)
- **MimeType**: `audio/mpeg` para .webm
- **Text**: Prompt vem do BigQuery ou fallback para `PromptDefault.Anamnesis`

## Labels

```csharp
Labels = SourcePlatformHelper.ToLabels(platform)
// Resultado: { "source_platform": "Telehealth" } ou { "source_platform": "Emergency" }
```

## Dynamic Prompts

O sistema suporta prompts customizados por workId:

1. API `POST /signed/upload` recebe `PromptId` e `Platform`
2. API insere na tabela `File_Transcription` com o `promptId`
3. Consumer busca `promptId` ‚Üí consulta tabela `Prompts` ‚Üí usa o texto do prompt
4. Se n√£o encontrar ‚Üí fallback para `PromptDefault.Anamnesis`

### Para adicionar novo tipo de prompt:
1. Inserir na tabela `Prompts` do BigQuery
2. O frontend envia o `PromptId` no POST
3. O Consumer busca automaticamente

## Error Handling

| Erro | A√ß√£o | shouldRetry |
|------|------|-------------|
| `ClientError` com StatusCode 429 | Log error ‚Üí return `(empty, true)` ‚Üí Pub/Sub `Nack` | ‚úÖ |
| `ClientError` outro | Log error ‚Üí return `(empty, false)` ‚Üí Pub/Sub `Ack` | ‚ùå |
| Exception gen√©rica | Log error ‚Üí return `(empty, false)` | ‚ùå |
| UsageMetadata null | Log info ‚Üí continua | N/A |
| Insert token data falha | Log error ‚Üí continua (n√£o bloqueia) | N/A |

## Token Tracking

Ap√≥s cada chamada, salvar no BigQuery (`Token_Data`):

```csharp
var tokenData = new TokenData
{
    PromptTokenCount = response.UsageMetadata.PromptTokenCount,
    CandidatesTokenCount = response.UsageMetadata.CandidatesTokenCount,
    TotalTokenCount = response.UsageMetadata.TotalTokenCount,
    FinishMessage = response.Candidates?.FirstOrDefault()?.FinishMessage,
    FinishReason = response.Candidates?.FirstOrDefault()?.FinishReason?.ToString()
};
```

## Regras para Edi√ß√£o de Prompts

### Prompt de Anamnese (`PromptDefault.Anamnesis`)

O prompt √© escrito em **portugu√™s** e segue estrutura r√≠gida:

1. **CONTEXTO**: Define papel do assistente
2. **VALIDA√á√ÉO PR√âVIA**: √Åudio inv√°lido ‚Üí JSON especial
3. **ESTRUTURA OBRIGAT√ìRIA**: QP, HMA, AP, Exame F√≠sico, Conduta
4. **REGRAS ABSOLUTAS**: JAMAIS inventar, ZERO interpreta√ß√£o
5. **LINGUAGEM**: Terminologia m√©dica formal, converter leigo ‚Üí m√©dico
6. **PROIBI√á√ïES**: Lista expl√≠cita do que N√ÉO fazer
7. **FIDELIDADE**: Copiar literalmente medica√ß√µes, comorbidades, alergias
8. **CIDs**: ‚â•5 CID-10, hierarquia definida
9. **VALIDA√á√ÉO FINAL**: Zero margem para suposi√ß√£o

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Ao editar o prompt, manter a estrutura de se√ß√µes. NUNCA remover regras de fidelidade ou proibi√ß√µes.

## Checklist para Mudan√ßas

- [ ] Temperature mantido em 0.0
- [ ] ResponseMimeType = "application/json"
- [ ] Schema atualizado se campos de resposta mudaram
- [ ] Token tracking mantido
- [ ] Error handling com retry para 429
- [ ] Labels com platform
- [ ] Prompt em portugu√™s com terminologia m√©dica
- [ ] Regras de fidelidade preservadas

name: k8s-deploy
description: Gera manifests Kubernetes (k8sdeploy.yaml) seguindo os padr√µes do projeto STT ‚Äî placeholders para CI/CD, Datadog APM labels, env vars, golden images, Redis sidecar (API). Use ao criar ou modificar deployments K8s. Triggers: "k8s", "kubernetes", "deploy", "k8sdeploy", "manifest", "replicas", "health check", "sidecar", ao trabalhar com infraestrutura.
metadata:
